December 2018 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = }} '''Alfie Robert John Mawson''' (born 19 January 1994) is an English professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[centre back]] for {{English football updater|Fulham}} club [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]].
He started his senior career with [[Brentford F.C.|Brentford]] from the youth ranks but spent his entire time on loan with four different clubs, including three separate loan spells with [[Maidenhead United F.C.|Maidenhead United]] and winning the [[EFL League Two|League Two]] Player of the Year award with [[Wycombe Wanderers F.C.|Wycombe Wanderers]] in 2015. He was transferred to [[Barnsley F.C.|Barnsley]] after failing to record a League appearance with Brentford, and made 49 appearances during the one season there, helping the former to win promotion to the Championship. He signed for [[Premier League]] club [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]] in 2016, and his second season there he featured in every Premier League match of the campaign but could not prevent the team from relegation.
Mawson has made six appearances for the [[England national under-21 football team|England under-21 team]] and was called up for the [[England national football team|England]] squad in March 2018 but did not play in the two friendlies.
==Early life== Mawson was born and raised in [[Hillingdon]], London.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://origin-www.football-league.co.uk/championship/news/20160826/alfie-mawson-set-for-swansea-move-after-fee-agreed-with-barnsley_2293322_5840148 |title=Alfie Mawson set for Swansea move after fee agreed with Barnsley |publisher=The Football League |date=26 August 2016 |accessdate=24 March 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180323213436/http://origin-www.football-league.co.uk/championship/news/20160826/alfie-mawson-set-for-swansea-move-after-fee-agreed-with-barnsley_2293322_5840148 |archive-date=23 March 2018 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/feb/10/swansea-alfie-mawson-chelsea-ball-dog |title=Alfie Mawson: 'I've got a football signed by Ranieri and the Chelsea players ... but my dog chewed it' |first=Stuart |last=James |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |date=10 February 2017 |accessdate=24 March 2018}}</ref>
==Club career== ===Early career=== A [[centre back]], Mawson joined the [[Reading F.C. Under-23s and Academy|Reading academy]] at the age of nine.<ref name=chance>{{cite web |url=http://world.brentfordfc.co.uk/page/LatestNews/0,,10421~2788675,00.html |title=Alfie looking to take his chance |publisher=Brentford F.C. |date=11 July 2012 |accessdate=24 March 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180323224649/http://world.brentfordfc.co.uk/page/LatestNews/0,,10421~2788675,00.html |archive-date=23 March 2018 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }}</ref> He remained with the club until his release at age 15 and subsequently had unsuccessful trials with [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|AFC Bournemouth]] and [[Millwall F.C.|Millwall]].<ref name=chance/>
===Brentford=== Mawson joined [[Brentford F.C.|Brentford]] in the summer of 2010 on a two-year scholarship.<ref name=footballconference>{{Cite web |url=http://footballconference.co.uk/news/details.php?news_id=9105 |title=Mawson returns to Maidenhead |date=21 February 2013 |publisher=Football Conference |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131007031331/http://footballconference.co.uk/news/details.php?news_id=9105 |archivedate=7 October 2013 |deadurl=yes}}</ref> He played for the [[Brentford F.C. Reserves and Academy#Youth Team|youth team]] during the [[2010–11 Brentford F.C. season|2010–11 season]] and progressed into the [[Brentford F.C. Reserves and Academy#Development Squad|Development Squad]] during the [[2011–12 Brentford F.C. season|2011–12 season]],<ref name=chance/> making nine appearances.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://world.brentfordfc.co.uk/page/DevelopmentSquad/0,,10421~2455685,00.html |title=Development squad appearances |publisher=Brentford F.C. |accessdate=24 March 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180323231920/http://world.brentfordfc.co.uk/page/DevelopmentSquad/0,,10421~2455685,00.html |archive-date=23 March 2018 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }}</ref> He also took over the youth team [[Captain (association football)|captaincy]] during the latter part of the season.<ref name=Contracts>{{Cite web |url=http://world.brentfordfc.co.uk/page/LatestNews/0,,10421~2724983,00.html |title=Development squad contracts |publisher=Brentford F.C. |date=6 April 2012 |accessdate=24 March 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180323232059/http://world.brentfordfc.co.uk/page/LatestNews/0,,10421~2724983,00.html |archive-date=23 March 2018 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }}</ref> In April 2012, Mawson signed a two-year professional contract at Brentford.<ref name=Contracts/> He was included in the squad for the Bees' [[pre-season]] tour of Germany in July 2012 and appeared in the opening match against [[ZFC Meuselwitz]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.brentfordfc.com/news/2012/july/zfc-meuselwitz-1-brentford-1/ |title=ZFC Meuselwitz 1 Brentford 1 |first=Mark |last=Chapman |publisher=Brentford F.C. |date=21 July 2012 |accessdate=24 March 2018}}</ref> Mawson suffered an injury-hit [[2012–13 Brentford F.C. season|2012–13 season]] and managed only 12 Development Squad appearances.<ref name=Maidenhead>{{cite web |url=https://www.brentfordfc.com/news/2013/october/mawson-returns-to-maidenhead/ |title=Mawson returns to Maidenhead |first=Chris |last=Wickham |publisher=Brentford F.C. |date=4 October 2013 |accessdate=24 March 2018}}</ref>
Mawson made his professional debut in a 5–0 [[EFL Cup|League Cup]] second round defeat at [[Derby County F.C.|Derby County]] in August 2013, replacing [[Sam Saunders (footballer)|Sam Saunders]] after 73 minutes.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/23764109 |title=Derby 5–0 Brentford |publisher=BBC Sport |date=27 August 2013 |accessdate=24 March 2018}}</ref> He scored his first goal of the [[2013–14 Brentford F.C. season|2013–14]] season with the opener in a 1–1 [[Professional Development League|Professional Development League 2 South]] draw with [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]] on 16 September 2013.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.brentfordfc.com/news/2013/september/brighton-ds-1-brentford-ds-1/ |title=Brighton DS 1 Bretnford DS 1 |first=Chris |last=Wickham |publisher=Brentford F.C. |date=16 September 2013 |accessdate=24 March 2018}}</ref> He scored his second goal in a 4–1 defeat to [[Ipswich Town F.C. Youth Academy|Ipswich Town]] on 26 November and his third in the return fixture against Brighton & Hove Albion on 27 January 2014.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.brentfordfc.com/news/2013/november/brentford-ds-1-ipswich-town-ds-4/ |title=Brentford DS 1 Ipswich Town DS 4 |first=Chris |last=Wickham |publisher=Brentford F.C. |date=26 November 2013 |accessdate=24 March 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.brentfordfc.com/news/2014/january/brentford-ds-2-brighton-ds-1/ |title=Brentford DS 2 Brighton DS 1 |first=Chris |last=Wickham |publisher=Brentford F.C. |date=27 January 2014 |accessdate=24 March 2018}}</ref> Mawson made 12 appearances and scored three goals for the Development Squad during the 2013–14 season,<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.brentfordfc.com/news/2014/may/201314-development-squad-stats/ |title=2013/14 Development squad stats |first=Ciaran |last=Brett |publisher=Brentford F.C. |date=31 May 2014 |accessdate=24 March 2018}}</ref> in addition to making one first-team appearance.<ref name=sb1314/> A torn [[Meniscus (anatomy)|meniscus]] in a Development Squad match ended Mawson's season early, prompting him to contemplate quitting football,<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/brentford-defender-quit-football---9276027 |title=Brentford defender almost quit football – now he's preparing for dream Wembley showdown with Wycombe |first=Matt |last=Lewis |website=Get West London |publisher=Trinity Mirror Southern |date=18 May 2015 |accessdate=24 March 2018}}</ref> before signing a new one-year deal on 5 June 2014.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.brentfordfc.com/news/2014/june/alfie-mawson-signs-new-contract/ |title=Alfie Mawson signs new contract |publisher=Brentford F.C. |date=5 June 2014 |accessdate=24 March 2018}}</ref> Mawson spent the entire [[2014–15 Brentford F.C. season|2014–15 season]] away on loan and after excelling, he was offered a new two-year contract in April 2015.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.brentfordfc.com/news/2015/april/three-young-players-offered-new-brentford-contracts/ |title=Three young players offered new Brentford contracts |first=Chris |last=Wickham |publisher=Brentford F.C. |date=30 April 2015 |accessdate=24 March 2018}}</ref> He turned the deal down and departed [[Griffin Park]] when his contract expired on 30 June.<ref name=BBC>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/33330254 |title=Alfie Mawson: Barnsley sign former Brentford defender |publisher=BBC Sport |date=30 June 2015 |accessdate=24 March 2018}}</ref> An undisclosed compensation fee was agreed in February 2016.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.brentfordfc.com/news/2016/february/compensation-agreement-finalised-for-alfie-mawson/ |title=Compensation agreement finalised for Alfie Mawson |publisher=Brentford F.C. |date=23 February 2016 |accessdate=24 March 2018}}</ref>
====Maidenhead United (loans)==== Mawson signed for [[National League South|Conference South]] club [[Maidenhead United F.C.|Maidenhead United]] on 13 December 2012 on a one-month loan,<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.brentfordfc.com/news/2012/december/mawson-joins-maidenhead-on-loan/ |title=Mawson joins Maidenhead on loan |first=Chris |last=Wickham |publisher=Brentford F.C. |date=13 December 2012 |accessdate=24 March 2018}}</ref> earning praise from manager [[Johnson Hippolyte]] for his performance on his debut in a 1–0 win against [[Truro City F.C.|Truro City]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.sloughexpress.co.uk/Sport/Football/Maidenhead-Utd-FC/New-defensive-duo-impress-Maidenhead-United-FC-boss-19122012.htm |title=New defensive duo impress Maidenhead United FC boss |first=Charles |last=Watts |newspaper=Slough & South Bucks Express |date=20 December 2012 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303222645/http://www.sloughexpress.co.uk/Sport/Football/Maidenhead-Utd-FC/New-defensive-duo-impress-Maidenhead-United-FC-boss-19122012.htm |archivedate=3 March 2016 |deadurl=yes}}</ref> Mawson returned to Brentford on 9 January 2013,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.maidenhead-advertiser.co.uk/Sport/Football/Maidenhead-Utd-FC/Mawson-returns-to-Brentford-after-Maidenhead-United-loan-spell-10012013.htm |title=Mawson returns to Brentford after Maidenhead United loan spell |first=Charles |last=Watts |newspaper=Maidenhead Advertiser |date=10 January 2013 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160305010903/http://www.maidenhead-advertiser.co.uk/Sport/Football/Maidenhead-Utd-FC/Mawson-returns-to-Brentford-after-Maidenhead-United-loan-spell-10012013.htm |archivedate=5 March 2016 |deadurl=yes}}</ref> before re-signing for Maidenhead United on loan for the rest of the season on 21 February.<ref name=footballconference/> He made nine appearances during the [[2012–13 Football Conference#Conference South|2012–13 season]] as Maidenhead narrowly avoided relegation.<ref name=Soccerway/> Mawson rejoined Maidenhead United for a third loan spell on 4 October 2013, which ran initially until 29 October and was later extended until 4 January 2014.<ref name=Maidenhead/><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.brentfordfc.com/news/2013/october/mawson-to-stay-at-maidenhead/ |title=Mawson to stay at Maidenhead |first=Chris |last=Wickham |publisher=Brentford F.C. |date=30 October 2013 |accessdate=24 March 2018}}</ref> Mawson was recalled from his loan early on 28 November after four appearances.<ref name=BrentfordFC>{{cite web |url=https://www.brentfordfc.com/news/2013/november/mawson-moves-to-luton-on-loan/ |title=Mawson moves to Luton on loan |first=Chris |last=Wickham |publisher=Brentford F.C. |date=28 November 2013 |accessdate=24 March 2018}}</ref>
====Luton Town (loan)==== On 28 November 2013, Mawson moved on loan to [[National League (division)|Conference Premier]] club [[Luton Town F.C.|Luton Town]] until 4 January 2014, to cover for injuries to [[Defender (association football)|defenders]] [[Steve McNulty]], [[Andy Parry]], [[Alex Lacey]] and [[Anthony Charles]].<ref name=BrentfordFC/><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.lutontown.co.uk/news/2013/november/hatters-loan-defensive-trio/ |title=Hatters loan defensive trio |publisher=Luton Town F.C. |date=28 November 2013 |accessdate=24 March 2018}}</ref> He made his debut in a 5–0 away league victory over [[Alfreton Town F.C.|Alfreton Town]] on 7 December, but was substituted for [[Joe Davis (footballer, born 1993)|Joe Davis]] at half time due to an injury.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/25164371 |title=Alfreton Town 0–5 Luton Town |publisher=BBC Sport |date=7 December 2013 |accessdate=24 March 2018}}</ref> He returned to Brentford on 10 January after making just one appearance.<ref name=Soccerway/><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.brentfordfc.com/news/2014/january/alfie-mawsons-luton-loan-ends/ |title=Alfie Mawson'S Luton loan ends |first=Chris |last=Wickham |publisher=Brentford F.C. |date=10 January 2014 |accessdate=24 March 2018}}</ref>
====Welling United (loan)==== On 31 January 2014, Mawson joined Conference Premier club [[Welling United F.C.|Welling United]] on loan until the end of the [[2013–14 Football Conference#Conference Premier|2013–14 season]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.brentfordfc.com/news/2014/january/alfie-mawson-joins-welling-united/ |title=Alfie Mawson joins Welling United |first=Chris |last=Wickham |publisher=Brentford F.C. |date=31 January 2014 |accessdate=24 March 2018}}</ref> He made his debut with a start in a 1–1 draw away to [[Tamworth F.C.|Tamworth]] on 22 February.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://uk.soccerway.com/matches/2014/02/22/england/conference-national/tamworth-fc/welling-united-fc/1507680/ |title=Tamworth vs. Welling United 1–1 |website=Soccerway |publisher=Perform Group |accessdate=24 March 2018}}</ref> Mawson scored his first Wings goal on his second appearance, heading home the second in a 2–0 home win over [[Gateshead F.C.|Gateshead]] on 25 February.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/26247261 |title=Welling United 2–0 Gateshead |publisher=BBC Sport |date=25 February 2014 |accessdate=24 March 2018}}</ref> A knee injury disrupted Mawson's time at Welling and he returned to Brentford at the end of the season, having made 9 appearances and scored one goal.<ref name=sb1314/><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.brentfordfc.com/news/2014/may/academy-players-return-after-loans-end/ |title=Academy players return after loans end |first=Chris |last=Wickham |publisher=Brentford F.C. |date=1 May 2014 |accessdate=24 March 2018}}</ref>
====Wycombe Wanderers (loan)==== Mawson joined [[EFL League Two|League Two]] club [[Wycombe Wanderers F.C.|Wycombe Wanderers]] on 9 August 2014 on a one-month youth loan, as cover for the injured [[Gary Doherty]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.brentfordfc.com/news/2014/august/alfie-mawson-joins-wycombe-on-loan/ |title=Alfie Mawson joins Wycombe on loan |first=Chris |last=Wickham |publisher=Brentford F.C. |date=9 August 2014 |accessdate=24 March 2018}}</ref> He made his Wycombe debut (the first [[English Football League|Football League]] appearance of his career) on the opening day of the [[2014–15 Wycombe Wanderers F.C. season|2014–15]] season, playing the full 90 minutes of a 2–0 away win over [[Newport County A.F.C.|Newport County]] alongside former Brentford teammate [[Aaron Pierre]] at centre back.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/28646857 |title=Newport County 0–2 Wycombe Wanderers |publisher=BBC Sport |date=9 August 2014 |accessdate=24 March 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.wycombe.vitalfootball.co.uk/article.asp?a=366027 |title=Blues off to a flier in Wales |first=Adam |last=Clift |website=Vital Wycombe |date=9 August 2014 |accessdate=24 March 2018}}</ref> After appearing in each of Wycombe's first six matches of the season, Mawson's loan was extended until 1 January 2015.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.brentfordfc.com/news/2014/september/alfie-mawson-extends-wycome-loan/ |title=Alfie Mawson extends Wycombe loan |first=Chris |last=Wickham |publisher=Brentford F.C. |date=1 September 2014 |accessdate=24 March 2018}}</ref> Mawson's 100% appearance record came to an end on his 19th appearance of the season, after suffering an injury in a 3–1 defeat to [[Burton Albion F.C.|Burton Albion]] on 17 November.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.brentfordfc.com/news/2014/november/loan-round-up8/ |title=Loan round up |first=Ciaran |last=Brett |publisher=Brentford F.C. |date=24 November 2014 |accessdate=24 March 2018}}</ref><ref name=sb1415/> He returned to action on 29 November against [[Hartlepool United F.C.|Hartlepool United]] and capped Wycombe's afternoon with the first Football League goal of his career in a 3–1 victory.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/30156386 |title=Hartlepool United 1–3 Wycombe Wanderers |publisher=BBC Sport |date=29 November 2014 |accessdate=24 March 2018}}</ref> His performance won him a place in the Football League Team of the Week.<ref name=FL>{{cite web |url=https://www.efl.com/news/2014/december/sky-bet-football-league-team-of-the-week/ |title=Sky Bet Football League Team of the Week |first=Ryan |last=Percival |publisher=The Football League |date=1 December 2014 |accessdate=24 March 2018}}</ref>
On 3 January 2015, Mawson's loan was extended until the end of the season, including the play-offs if required, with no recall clause.<ref name=Wycombe>{{cite web |url=https://www.wycombewanderers.co.uk/news/2015/january/alfie-mawson-to-stay-for-the-season/ |title=Alfie Mawson to stay for the season |publisher=Wycombe Wanderers F.C. |date=3 January 2015 |accessdate=24 March 2018}}</ref> Mawson's three goals in four matches in March helped ensure Wycombe held onto the third automatic promotion place.<ref name=sb1415/><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.statto.com/football/teams/wycombe-wanderers/2014-2015/table/2015-03-24 |title=Wycombe Wanderers 2014–2015: Table: Table on Tuesday 24th March 2015 |publisher=Statto Organisation |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150402115849/http://www.statto.com/football/teams/wycombe-wanderers/2014-2015/table/2015-03-24 |archivedate=2 April 2015 |deadurl=yes}}</ref> He scored a vital winning goal in Wycombe's 2–1 victory over [[Cheltenham Town F.C.|Cheltenham Town]] on 11 April,<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/32179955 |title=Wycombe Wanderers 2–1 Cheltenham Town |publisher=BBC Sport |date=11 April 2015 |accessdate=24 March 2018}}</ref> to end a run of successive defeats, which kept Wycombe four points clear of fourth-place [[Bury F.C.|Bury]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.statto.com/football/teams/wycombe-wanderers/2014-2015/table/2015-04-11 |title=Wycombe Wanderers 2014–2015: Table: Table on Saturday 11th April 2015 |publisher=Statto Organisation |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151208133926/http://www.statto.com/football/teams/wycombe-wanderers/2014-2015/table/2015-04-11 |archivedate=8 December 2015 |deadurl=yes}}</ref> Mawson's performance was recognised with his second inclusion of the season in the Football League Team of the Week.<ref name=FootballLeague>{{cite web |url=https://www.efl.com/news/2015/april/sky-bet-football-league-team-of-the-week/ |title=Sky Bet Football League Team of the Week |first=Alex |last=Butcher |publisher=The Football League |date=13 April 2015 |accessdate=24 March 2018}}</ref> Mawson's 97th-minute winner in a 3–2 victory over [[Northampton Town F.C.|Northampton Town]] on the final day was not enough to prevent Wycombe from having to settle for fourth place and a [[2015 Football League play-offs#League Two|play-off semi-final]] matchup versus [[Plymouth Argyle F.C.|Plymouth Argyle]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/32460232 |title=Northampton Town 2–3 Wycombe Wanderers |publisher=BBC Sport |date=2 May 2015 |accessdate=24 March 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.statto.com/football/teams/wycombe-wanderers/2014-2015/table/2015-05-02 |title=Wycombe Wanderers 2014–2015: Table: Table on Saturday 2nd May 2015 |publisher=Statto Organisation |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150707174333/http://www.statto.com/football/teams/wycombe-wanderers/2014-2015/table/2015-05-02 |archivedate=7 July 2015 |deadurl=yes}}</ref> However, his season ended in disappointment after a penalty shoot-out defeat to Southend United in the [[2015 Football League Two play-off Final|final]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/32762821 |title=Southend United 1–1 Wycombe Wanderers |first=Phil |last=Shepka |publisher=BBC Sport |date=23 May 2015 |accessdate=24 March 2018}}</ref> He finished the 2014–15 season with 50 appearances and seven goals.<ref name=sb1415/> Mawson swept the board at Wycombe's end-of-season awards ceremony, winning the Supporters' and Players' Player of the Year awards, in addition to the Official Wycombe Wanderers Supporters Association's Player, Young Player and Away Travel Player of the Year awards.<ref name=SeasonAwards>{{cite news |url=http://www.bucksfreepress.co.uk/sport/12929717.Mawson_cleans_up_at_Wanderers__end_of_season_awards_night/ |title=Mawson cleans up at Wanderers' end of season awards night |first=Greg |last=Styles |newspaper=Bucks Free Press |date=4 May 2015 |accessdate=24 March 2018}}</ref> He also won the Wycombe Wanderers Independent Supporters' Club Player of the Year award.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.brentfordfc.com/news/2015/april/wycombe-supporters-award-for-alfie-mawson/ |title=Wycombe supporters' award for Alfie Mawson |first=Chris |last=Wickham |publisher=Brentford F.C. |date=27 April 2015 |accessdate=24 March 2018}}</ref> He finished third in the running for the League Two Player of the Year award.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/12040/9814522/patrick-bamford-has-been-named-sky-bet-championship-player-of-the-year |title=Patrick Bamford named Sky Bet Championship Player of the Year |publisher=Sky Sports |date=20 April 2015 |accessdate=24 March 2018}}</ref>
===Barnsley=== Mawson signed for [[EFL League One|League One]] club [[Barnsley F.C.|Barnsley]] on 30 June 2015 on a three-year contract.<ref name=BBC/> He scored his first goal for the Reds in a 3–2 away win over Millwall.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/33857834 |title=Millwall 2–3 Barnsley |publisher=BBC Sport |date=18 August 2015 |accessdate=24 March 2018}}</ref> He impressed in the [[2015–16 Barnsley F.C. season|2015–16 season]], scoring seven goals in 58 appearances.<ref name=sb1516/> He played a big part in Barnsley's season, including beating Oxford United 3–2 to win the [[Football League Trophy]] on 3 April 2016,<ref name=2016FLT>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35906363 |title=Barnsley 3–2 Oxford United |first=Phil |last=Cartwright |publisher=BBC Sport |date=3 April 2016 |accessdate=24 March 2018}}</ref> and in earning promotion to the Championship after beating Millwall 3–1 in the play-off final.<ref name=2016PO>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36352352 |title=Barnsley 3–1 Millwall |first=Rob |last=Stevens |publisher=BBC Sport |date=29 May 2016 |accessdate=24 March 2018}}</ref>
===Swansea City=== [[File:Alfie Mawson 2017-11-29 1.jpg|thumb|upright|Mawson playing for [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]] in 2017]]
After just four league matches experience in the [[EFL Championship|Championship]] with Barnsley, Mawson signed for [[Premier League]] club [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]] on 30 August 2016 on a four-year contract<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37201308 |title=Alfie Mawson: Swansea City sign Barnsley defender |publisher=BBC Sport |date=30 August 2016 |accessdate=24 March 2018}}</ref> for an undisclosed fee.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.swanseacity.com/news/alfie-mawson-aims-seize-swansea-city-chance-after-joining-barnsley |title=Alfie Mawson aims to seize Swansea City chance after joining from Barnsley |publisher=Swansea City A.F.C. |date=30 August 2016 |accessdate=24 March 2018}}</ref> He made his full debut on 22 October 2016 in the 0–0 home draw against [[Watford F.C.|Watford]]<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37663772 |title=Swansea City 0–0 Watford |first=Dafydd |last=Pritchard |publisher=BBC Sport |date=22 October 2016 |accessdate=24 March 2018}}</ref> in the Premier League after which he presented with the man of the match award for his work in defence.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.swansea.vitalfootball.co.uk/article.asp?a=465893 |title=Mawson wins man of the match on debut vs Watford |website=Vital Swansea |date=26 October 2016 |accessdate=24 March 2018}}</ref> He scored his first goal for the club on 3 January 2017 in a 2–1 win against [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38441016 |title=Crystal Palace 1–2 Swansea City |first=Michael |last=Emons |publisher=BBC Sport |date=3 January 2017 |accessdate=24 March 2018}}</ref>
In the [[2017–18 Swansea City A.F.C. season|2017–18]] season, Mawson scored the only goal in a 1–0 home win against [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] on 22 January 2018 to help Swansea's survival hopes.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42685212 |title=Swansea City 1–0 Liverpool |first=Michael |last=Pearlman |publisher=BBC Sport |date=22 January 2018 |accessdate=24 March 2018}}</ref> Despite this, the club struggled, particularly on the attacking point of view, and despite the player featured in all 38 Premier League fixtures, he did not prevent the club's relegation, which was confirmed on the final day of the season.<ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44020155 | title=Swansea 1–2 Stoke | publisher = BBC Sport | first = Dafydd | last = Pritchard | date=14 May 2018 | accessdate=4 July 2018}}</ref><ref name=sb1718/>
===Fulham=== After Swansea's relegation from the Premier League, Mawson signed for newly promoted club [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] on a four-year contract for an undisclosed fee, reported to be in the region of £20 million.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45024377 |title=Alfie Mawson: Fulham sign defender from Swansea City |publisher=BBC Sport |date=2 August 2018 |accessdate=2 August 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2018/august/02/totally-mawson |title=Mawson signs |publisher=Fulham F.C. |date=2 August 2018 |accessdate=2 August 2018}}</ref>
==International career== Mawson played six times and scored one goal for the [[England national under-21 football team|England national under-21 team]] from 2016 to 2017, scoring his only goal on 19 June 2017 in a 2–1 win against [[Slovakia national under-21 football team|Slovakia]] at the [[2017 UEFA European Under-21 Championship]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.englandfootballonline.com/MatchRsl/MatchRslTmU21pg4.html |title=England's matches: The under 21's: 2010–20 |website=England Football Online |publisher=Chris Goodwin, Glen Isherwood & Peter Young |date=9 June 2018 |accessdate=21 July 2018}}</ref> England were eventually knocked out by [[Germany national under-21 football team|Germany]] in the semi-final.{{citation needed|date=March 2018}}
On 15 March 2018, Mawson was named for the first time in the [[England national football team|England]] squad for pre-[[2018 FIFA World Cup]] friendlies against the [[Netherlands national football team|Netherlands]] and [[Italy national football team|Italy]] in March.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43344416 |title=England call-ups for uncapped quartet as Jack Wilshere earns recall |publisher=BBC Sport |date=15 March 2018 |accessdate=15 March 2018}}</ref>
